biography.value:
Leaders of law enforcement units in undead cities, darakhul captains are stoic and steely darakhul hand-selected by the city's leadership for the role.

Patrol Teams.

When on patrol, darakhul captains ride @creature[ghoulsteed|ccodex|ghoulsteeds] and are rarely without a handful of darakhul and ghouls at their sides. In the larger cities, captains patrol with one or two @creature[emperor's hyena|ToB2|emperor's hyenas].

Dangerous Position.

Many captains meet their ends not from threats outside the city but from forces within it. Captains regularly face the dangers of being assassinated by a rival or killed by a city leader upset about recent events.

Hungry Dead Nature.

The darakhul doesn't require air or sleep.

description.value: The darakhul captain makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claw, and one with its longsword. Alternatively, it can make four attacks with its longsword.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 ([[/damage 2d8 + 4 type=piercing]]) damage plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=necrotic]]) damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw or contract @disease[darakhul fever|ToB2].

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 ([[/damage 2d6 + 4 type=slashing]]) damage plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=necrotic]]) damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw or be &Reference[condition=paralyzed] for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a humanoid is &Reference[condition=paralyzed] for more than 2 rounds, it contracts @disease[darakhul fever|ToB2].

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 ([[/damage 1d8 + 4 type=slashing]]) damage, or 9 ([[/damage 1d10 + 4 type=slashing]]) damage if used with two hands, plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=necrotic]]) damage.
Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+7]]{+7} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 8 ([[/damage 1d10 + 3 type=piercing]]) damage plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=necrotic]]) damage.

The darakhul captain targets one &Reference[condition=incapacitated] creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must make a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=15]] saving throw, taking 27 ([[/damage 5d10 type=necrotic]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If the victim has @disease[darakhul fever|ToB2], this reduction can't be removed until the victim recovers from the disease. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain by this attack rises as a @creature[ghast] [[/r 1d4]] hours later under the darakhul captain's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The captain can have no more than four @creature[ghast|mm|ghasts] under its control at one time.

For 1 minute, the darakhul captain can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a [[/r d4]] to its roll provided it can hear and understand the captain. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the captain is &Reference[condition=incapacitated].
A darakhul in a prepared disguise has advantage on Charisma (&Reference[skill=Deception]) checks made to pass as a living creature. While using this ability, it loses its Stench.
The darakhul captain's weapon attacks are magical. When the captain hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra [[/damage 2d6 type=necrotic]] damage (included in the attack).

Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the darakhul must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw or be &Reference[condition=poisoned] until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the darakhul's Stench for 24 hours.
While in sunlight, the darakhul has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) checks that rely on sight.
The darakhul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.
